titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jesus Salvador Treviño Papers M0624
titlestmt.author: Processed by Special Collections staff; machine-readable finding aid created by Steven Mandeville-Gamble

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-09-20 09:49:49 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Jesus Salvador Treviño papers

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Mexican-American film writer and director, primarily for public television.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Jesus Salvador Treviño papers, M0624, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical and digital items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Note that material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use. Audiovisual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Grant proposals, story outlines, script developments and treatments, publicity, soundtracks, videos, etc., all pertaining to the television scripts written and/or produced by Treviño. Includes photographs of Treviño, one by Harry Gamboa.

"New Mexican Cinema" in Spring, 1979 issue of Film Quarterly, University of California, Berkeley, CA 94720. Pages 26-37.
"Mexican Cinema-New Directors" in SOMOS magazine, May 1979. Los Angeles, CA 90033. Pages 32-37

"Chicano Cinema: A Viewpoint" in Chamba Notes. 3 Pages.
"Nous Sommes Chicanos" in Le Monde Diplomatique, Paris, France. May, 1980. 1 page.

"Latino Portrayals in Film and Television" in Hispanic Americans and Mass Media, a publication of the Aspen Institute for Humanistic Studies, New York, New York for a conference at the Aspen Institute, Colorado, August 2-8, 1980. Pages 71-87.

"Lo Sviluppo Del Cinema Chicano" in America Latina: Lo Schermo Conteso, publication of the Pesaro Film Festival, Pesaro, Italy. No. 8m 1983. Delivered July, 1981
"Form and Technique in Chicano Cinema" in Chicano Cinema edited by Gary Keller, Bilingual Review Press. 1985
"Chicano Cinema" in The New Scholar, Vol. 8, 1982. Pages 167-180. University of California at Santa Barbara Press, Santa Barbara, CA
"Chicano Films and Beyond" in Caminos Magazine, Los Angeles, California, Nov. 1982. Pages 6-7, 51. Trevino also co-edited this edition of Caminos Magazine.
"Presencia del Cine Chicano" in A Traves De La Frontera, Pages 194-200. Published by Centro de Estudios Economicos Investigaciones Esteticas, U.N.A.M. August, 1983

"Latinos and PBS: The 2% Factor" in Caminos Magazine, March, 1983

"Latinos y TV Publica: El Factor de Dos por ciento" in La Opinion. Sunday Supplement to the Los Angeles, Daily, July 10, 1983

"The Need for More Spanish American Affairs Programs" 2 Pages. Presentation to the General Assembly of the Public Broadcast Service (PBS) Public Affairs Workshop held in Atlanta, Georgia. September 25, 1972
"Chicano Statement to the National Association of Educational Broadcasters," written and sent on behalf of Chicano PBS producers on May 23, 1972

"Comentarios de un Cineasta Chicano" Delivered to the General Assembly of the UNAM/CUEC (Universidad Autonoma de Mexico/Centro de Estudios Cinematograficos) Seminar on Latinamerican Cinema. Mexico City, Mexico. August 12, 1974. 2 pages.
"The Roar of a Mighty River" Delivered to the Annual General Assembly of the Texas Catholic Conference, San Antonio, Texas. September 23, 1974. 4 pages.
"Interview by Francisco X. Camplis" for his article "Towards A Raza Cinema" Later published in Chicano & Film edited by Chon Noriega, Univ. of Minn. 1992.
"Cine Chicano" Informe al Comite De Cineastas de America Latina, La Habana, Cuba. June 15, 1978. 6 pages.

"Hispanics and Public Broadcasting-A History of Neglect" (with Jose Luis Ruiz) A presentation to the Rockefeller Seminar on Independent Television Makers and Public Communications Policy. New York, New York. June 1979. 12 Pages

Hispanics and CPB: In Quest of National Programming" (with Jose Luis Ruiz) Presentation to the Members of the Board of the Corporation For Public Broadcasting. Washington, D.C. October 17, 1979. Trevino was unable to attend and presentation was made by Carlos Penichet
"Informe Sobre Cine Chicano" Presentation to the General Assembly of the First Annual Festival of New Latin American Cinema, Dec. 2-16, 1979
"Declaracion de Solidaridad del Cine Chicano Con El Nuevo Cine Latinoamericano" Statement by Chicano Delegation to Festival of New Latinamerican Cinema, La Habana, Cuba Dec. 3, 1979

"Adapting History to Drama and Making Ends Meet." A Presentation made to the Hispanic Southwest Regional Conference on Media and the Humanities, sponsored by the NEH Media Program. Dec. 4-7, 1980. 11 pages
"Mexican Cinema at the Crossroads" Presentation to the San Jose Fine Film Society, San Jose Museum of Art, San Jose, California. Feb. 20, 1982. 5 pages.
"Aesthetics of Chicano Cinema" presentation at the University of California, Berkeley, CA. February 26, 1982. 5 pages.
"Foreigners in Our Native Land" Presentation at the Film Archives, August 22. 1982. 5 pages

"North American Media and the Chicano" Presentation to the Seccion de "Los Medios Massivos de Communicacion y La Soberania de los Pueblos," of the Dialogo de las Americas conference, Sept. 9-13, 1982, Mexico City, D.F. Mexico. 5 pages

"Hacia Una Estructura Dramaurgica Para El nuevo Cine Latinoamericano" (with Alberto Durant) Presentation to the Seminario de Dramaturgia Cinematografica, at the 4th Annual Festival of New Latin American Cinema, La Habana, Cuba. Dec. 3-14, 1982

"Emergence of Chicano Cinema" Regents Lectureship at University of California at Santa Barbara, California, July 12, 1984. 14 Pages. This is a slide presentation that served as the basis for the later presentation at UC Irvine
"The Chicano Documentary" Regents Lectureship at the University of California at Santa Barbara, California, July 18, 1984. 14 pages
"The Role of the Chicano Filmmaker" Regents Lectureship at the University of California at Santa Barbara, California, July 19, 1984. 9 pages.
"Press Statement on behalf of Guadalupe Art Center" San Antonio, Texas. August 24,1984
"Chicano Cinema: An Overview" Presentation at Texas Luthern College, Seguin, Texas. May 2, 1985. 14 pages. A variation of the Regents Lecture on Emergence of Chicano Cinema.
"Making Movies About Mexico" A Presentaion at the University of Texas at El Paso, Texas on the occasion of the screening of Neighbors: The US and Mexico. April 23, 1985

"Vision Historica Del Cine Chicano," Presentation at the University of California, Irvine on the occasion of the Conference on Mexican and Chicano Film, May 18, 1985. 20 Pages. An expanded version of the Santa Barbara Regents Lectureship with emphasis on the impact of new technologies on Chicano filmmaking.
"The Making of Seguin" Presentation at St. Mary's College Notre Dame, Indiana. Feb. 2, 1986
"Emergence of Chicano Cinema" Presentation at the University of Iowa, Iowa City, Iowa. February 2, 1989.
"Chicano Cinema and Social Work" Keynote address to the Trabajadores de La Raza Annual Dinner, Los Angeles, CA. with film clips. October 11, 1991
"Art with a Vision" Keynote address at the 1992 Graduation Ceremonies of Columbia College Hollywood, June 28, 1992.
"My Teaching Philosophy." Presentation to faculty search committee of USC School of Cinema and Television for Tenure track position teaching directing. March 12, 1993
